0.Pros: -Amazing coworkers-Always work to be done-Fast-paced-Learn great multi-tasking skills-Learn a great deal of patience
0.Cons: -Afternoons were sometimes busy with short staff-Dealing with angry/ unpleasant customers-Miscommunication between management and staff

1.Pros: Help paying bills, help family members that are in need of help,buy your own things, support your self and your dreams,
1.Cons: Getting fired, down payments, and last but least irritation

2.Cons: What can I say it's mickey d's

3.Pros: Fun, easy, meeting a lot of ppl

4.Pros: Absolutely love eating food there and working there.

5.Pros: Established some wonderful relationships with co-workers.Co-workers are mostly friendly.Managers are also very friendly
5.Cons: Lunch rush..The occassional 40 cheeseburgers and 60 fries order.

6.Pros: I liked working at McDonald's. It was a learning experience. Some of my fellow workers were very friendly. I also got to interact with customers.
6.Cons: Some of the managers had a bad attitude towards their employees. Some other co workers had bad attitudes. They would not give me enough hours to work.

7.Pros: Half off food. That's really it
7.Cons: They put you anywhere they want you regardless if you have been properly trained.The hours aren't too good.The pay is awful

8.Cons: Nothing is mentally stimulating, and everything is grey in the back with no windows.

9.Pros: I love my fellow co-workers, we always if not, mostly get along with each other. Most of the managers are alright, but some can be a little tedious sometimes. I also love that Mcdonald's is considerably flexible with their work schedules.
9.Cons: Some customers get very upset and sometimes cause a scene, which can be an annoyance. I get that they get upset, but that doesn't mean you should cause a scene. Other than that i believe the work is fine.
